current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To amend the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 to prevent the illegal trafficking of supplemental nutrition assistance program benefits by requiring all program beneficiaries to show valid photo identification when purchasing items with program benefits.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry

short-title.#text: Food Stamp Fraud Prevention and Accountability Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 6 of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008

header.#text: Disqualification for using another EBT card

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , any person who has been found by a State or Federal court or administrative agency in a hearing under
to have intentionally used an EBT card that was issued  to a household of which the person is not a member shall  be ineligible for benefits under this Act.

text.#text: Subject to any requirements established by the

header.#text: Disqualification for using another EBT card

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 7(h)(9) of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ,  the State agency shall list on the EBT card the name of each member of the household who may use the card.

text.#text: If a State agency elects not to require that an EBT card contain a photograph described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be required to show photographic identification at the point of sale when using the EBT card.

text.#text: A member of a household with an EBT card issued by a State agency described in

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S1922 IS: Food Stamp Fraud Prevention and Accountability Act
